title: Ticket #405: Remote IWD support for VM universe to avoid file transfer
description:
At CondorWeek 2009, Wipro made a nice suggestion that we add remote IWD support to the VM universe to avoid file transfer.

Is it possible that this capability is already there if file transfer is not used?
remarks:
2009-May-01 11:25:29 by jfrey:
File transfer is always enabled for the vm universe. There are attributes to control whether vm image files should be transferred from the submit machine or read directly on the execute machine. However, condor_submit assumes the image files are always accessible from the submit machine, as it performs some existence tests. When the files aren't transferred, it's assumed that they are on a shared filesystem. This assumption is consistent with the vanilla universe.

2009-Aug-14 16:59:22 by jfrey:
Wipro's code contribution includes code to read vm cpu usage from the VMware client tools. This is covered in #669.

2010-Jun-04 16:00:03 by tannenba:
Is ticket made obsolete now due to #1351 ?

2010-Jun-07 11:45:32 by jfrey:
Yes, this ticket is now obsolete.
